articles.body: This type of finance is typically used when you want to buy a new property while you sell your own or you want to renovate your current property with a view to either securing a mortgage against it or sell it at a higher price. Such loans are secured against at least one owned property or asset and are usually repaid when a more conventional mortgage can be arranged or when you sell the residential property at a higher price.
articles.title: Residential bridging finance

articles.body:
Similar to Residential, in that at least one property or asset is used as security. This finance is available for Limited companies for a variety of purposes, such as cash flow injection, purchasing a new premises, purchase of stock asset, expansion plans etc.

Bridging finance in this instance is particularly useful as it can be arranged relatively quickly allowing businesses to be flexible in their planning. Exit strategies to pay off such finance may be a proven and guaranteed order book, selling of existing property, or obtaining a more conventional mortgage.
articles.title: Commercial bridging finance

articles.body:
Finance specifically designed for a wide variety of development projects, whether it be single residential plots, a housing estate project to industrial and commercial units. This type of finance is also available for conversion, restoration and renovation projects.

Development finance is similar to Bridging finance in respect to the short term and interest only nature of both solutions, however Development lending is based on the projects final Gross Development Value (GDV), that is the capital value of the completed project when sold to a willing purchaser on the open market.

With that in mind it allows for lending on a much larger scale and should the development increase in value as the project progresses further funds may be released, allowing up to 100% of the construction costs.

We have access to lenders that have helped provide funding solutions for development projects on a variety of levels, from the small scale singular residential conversions to multi-plot sites.
articles.title: Development finance

articles.body:
Auction finance can be arranged in principle ahead of an auction. You cannot guarantee that you will win the auction for a property, however you can arrange bridging finance ahead of the auction so that you can bid in confidence knowing you have finance arranged to give you the funds you need to complete the purchase.

Auction Bridging loans are also used when a property is deemed “unmortgageable” cases whereby a property you have purchased at auction doesn’t have a kitchen or a bathroom installed or there are no internal doors for example. Such properties are unlikely to be accepted by high street lenders who will view them as uninhabitable in their current state. A bridging loan will help you secure the property at the auction and may provide the funds you need to renovate the property to secure a mortgage against.
articles.title: Auction finance

articles.body:
Financing that is largely used by developers where further access to finance may be required on top of existing funding.

As such Mezzanine Finance is usually secured on a Second Charge basis behind the developers initial funding for the project. Mezzanine lenders will tend to charge a higher rate of interest on the finance and will have agreements in place with the developer to receive an fixed percentage of the projects profit. We can provide funding for all size of developers.
